page.title: 04EVENTS. LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: THE GT HARWOOD FAIR WAS GRANTED TO ADAM NOWELL IN 1338 AS A REWARD FOR FIGHTING IN SCOTLAND IN THE ARMY OF KING EDWARD THE 3RD.FROM THEN ONWARDS THE LOWER TOWN WITH ITS MARKETS AND FAIRS WAS A SOURCE OF INCOME TO THE NOWELL FAMLY IN 1770.ALEXANDER NOWELL SOLD THE LOWER TOWN AND THE RIGHTS OF THE MARKET AND FAIR TO PAY HIS DEBTS. IN 1819 THE CHARTER WAS BOUGHT BY MR RICHARD GRIMSHOW LOMAX. A LETTER WRITTEN TO THE BLACKBURN TIMES WAS CRITICAL OF THE SHOW. IT COMPLAINED ABOUT THE DRUNKENNESS WHICH WENT ON AT FAIR TIME.IN 1895 THE URBAN DISTRICT COUNCIL TOOK OVER THE RUNNING OF THE FAIR AND MARKET.THE GT.HARWOOD CIVIC SOCIETY REVIVED THE FAIR IN 1973 IT WAS HELD AGAIN IN 1983.THE TOWN CRYER STILL INTRODUCES IT.IT IS PLANNED TO HOLD THE FAIR EVERY 10 YEARS.
